attributes.action: Award a George Cross to the NHS for its Covid work (like Malta GC)
attributes.additional_details: The island of Malta was awarded the GC in 1942 for its bravery and commitment during the great siege, the island was constantly bombed but the loyal people of Malta continued to remain loyal and support the allied forces operating from the island. In 2020 and 2021 the Paramedics, A&E, ITU and other frontline NHS staff risk their health and sanity battling with a new existential threat. Short of personnel and supplies and exhausted they stay resolutely at their posts in a similar way to Malta
attributes.background: Award a George Cross to the NHS as a body in recognition of the indefatigable efforts of its staff during this COVID crisis.

rejection.details:
We cannot accept petitions that call for specific awards or honours, such as the George Cross, to be given to individuals or organisations, because we can only accept petitions about matters for which the Government or Parliament are responsible.

There is an independent process for considering nominations for awards and honours, including the George Cross, and advising the Queen on granting these, so it is not something the Government or Parliament can do.

Information about Civilian gallantry is available here: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/civilian-gallantry-operation#the-george-cross-committee

And details of how to nominate someone for an honour or award are available here: https://www.gov.uk/honours/recommend-bravery-award
